column4: E: Couldn't find package xchat-gnome <- on sudo apt-get install xchat-gnome
thx

(hi, i started with linux today :P )
well i did have debian running a long while ago, but just for simple services, and i messed up the security settings
!dapper > firenu
hm :<
its 6.06
thundr excellent =)
okay lets say i want the real one, any hassles or unsupported things or anything ?
not really.
is there a reason you need to use apt-cache?
im trying to install xchat =)
are you using Dapper?
havent the slightest. i just started with ubuntu some moments ago.
Dapper's the common name of the latest released version of Ubuntu
if you've just downloaded Ubuntu, chances are it's Dapper
yes, that's the one.
if you don't want to get complicated, under the applications menu is add-remove programs
just type in xchat and you'll get the xchat-gnome package installed.  It's a simpler verion of xchat, but if you want the real thing, just click show community (unsupported) applications
I'm running plenty of "unsupported" software right now.
